meanings.definition: To march or walk energetically, especially over long distances.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers yomped through the forest during their training exercise.
meanings.sent2: She yomped to the top of the hill to enjoy the beautiful view.
meanings.sent3: The kids yomped around the playground, full of energy and laughter.
meanings.sent4: His heart yomped with excitement as he approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The determined hiker yomped up the mountain, one step at a time.

meanings.definition: The act of marching or walking energetically, especially over long distances.
meanings.sent1: The yomp through the desert was exhausting but rewarding.
meanings.sent2: The yomp of the marathon runners echoed through the city streets.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's yomp across the icy terrain was quite comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The yomp of the protesters could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent5: The yomp of the elephants shook the ground beneath our feet.
